intro: Schleidenia inundata, commonly known as the water spleenwort, is a species of liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its simple, thallus-like structure. The plant typically grows on damp soil or rock surfaces, thriving in humid conditions. Its morphology includes a leafy shoot system with small, closely spaced leaves. Schleidenia inundata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
